parameters.info: Input image file name
parameters.name: image

parameters.info: Use adaptive rms_box when determining rms and mean maps
parameters.name: adaptive_rms_box

parameters.info: Sources with pixels above adaptive_thresh*clipped_rms will be considered as bright sources. Minimum is 10.0.
parameters.name: adaptive_thresh

parameters.info: Box size, step size for rms/mean map calculation near bright sources. Specify as (box, step) in pixels.
parameters.name: rms_box_bright

parameters.info: Decompose Gaussian residual image into multiple scales
parameters.name: atrous_do

parameters.info: Perform source extraction on each wavelet scale
parameters.name: atrous_bdsm_do

parameters.info: Max allowed wavelength order, 0 => calculate inside program
parameters.name: atrous_jmax

parameters.info: Low pass filter, either 'b3' or 'tr', for B3 spline or Triangle
parameters.name: atrous_lpf

parameters.info: Restrict wavelet Gaussians to islands found in original image
parameters.name: atrous_orig_isl

parameters.info: Fit to the sum of remaining wavelet scales
parameters.name: atrous_sum

parameters.info: Use fast SciPy FFT for convolution
parameters.name: use_scipy_fft

parameters.info: FWHM of restoring beam. Specify as (maj, min, pos ang E of N) in degrees. E.g., beam = (0.06, 0.02, 13.3). None => get from header
parameters.name: beam

parameters.info: Show options for Gaussian flagging
parameters.name: flagging_opts

parameters.info: Flag Gaussian if centre is outside border - flag_bordersize pixels
parameters.name: flag_bordersize

parameters.info: Flag Gaussian if area greater than flag_maxsize_bm times beam area
parameters.name: flag_maxsize_bm

parameters.info: Flag Gaussian if fwhm-contour times factor extends beyond island
parameters.name: flag_maxsize_fwhm

parameters.info: Flag Gaussian if x, y bounding box around sigma-contour is factor times island bbox
parameters.name: flag_maxsize_isl

parameters.info: Flag Gaussian if peak is greater than flag_maxsnr times image value at the peak
parameters.name: flag_maxsnr

parameters.info: Flag Gaussian if peak is greater than flag_maxsnr times image value at the peak
parameters.name: flag_minsize_bm

parameters.info: Flag Gaussian if peak is less than flag_minsnr times thresh_pix times local rms
parameters.name: flag_minsnr

parameters.info: Flag sources smaller than flag_minsize_bm times beam area
parameters.name: flag_smallsrc

parameters.info: Frequency in Hz of input image. E.g., frequency = 74e6. None => get from header.
parameters.name: frequency

parameters.info: Background mean map: 'default' => calc whether to use or not, 'zero' => 0, 'const' => clipped mean, 'map' => use 2-D map
parameters.name: mean_map

parameters.info: If True and beam_spectrum is None, then assume header beam is for median frequency and scales with frequency for channels
parameters.name: beam_sp_derive

parameters.info: Get beams for each channel in FITS header. Eg. BMAJ1, BMAJ1, BPA1; BMAJ2, BMIN2, BPA2
parameters.name: multi_chan_beam

parameters.info: FWHM of synthesized beam per channel. Specify as [(bmaj_ch1, bmin_ch1, bpa_ch1), (bmaj_ch2, bmin_ch2, bpa_ch2), etc.] in degrees. E.g., beam_spectrum = [(0.01, 0.01, 45.0), (0.02,0.01, 34.0)] for two channels. None => all equal to beam
parameters.name: beam_spectrum

parameters.info: List of channels to average if collapse_mode = 'average', starting from 0. E.g., collapse_av = [0, 1, 5]. [] => all
parameters.name: collapse_av

parameters.info: Number of the channel for source extraction, if collapse_mode = 'single', starting from 0
parameters.name: collapse_ch0

parameters.info: Collapse method: 'average' or 'single'. Average channels or take single channel to perform source detection on
parameters.name: collapse_mode

parameters.info: Weighting: 'unity' or 'rms'. Average channels with weights = 1 or 1/rms_clip^2 if collapse_mode = 'average'
parameters.name: collapse_wt

parameters.info: Frequency in Hz of channels in input image when more than one channel is present. E.g., frequency_sp = [74e6, 153e6]. None => get from header
parameters.name: frequency_sp

parameters.info: Box size, step size for rms/mean map calculation. Specify as (box, step) in pixels. E.g., rms_box = (40, 10) => box of 40x40 pixels, step of 10 pixels. None => calculate inside program
parameters.name: rms_box

parameters.info: Show output options
parameters.name: output_opts

parameters.info: Directory of input FITS files. If not set, get from filename
parameters.name: indir

parameters.info: 'overwrite'/'append': If output_all=True, delete existing files or append a new directory
parameters.name: opdir_overwrite

parameters.info: Write out all files automatically to directory 'filename_pybdsm'
parameters.name: output_all

parameters.info: Print basic timing information
parameters.name: print_timing

parameters.info: Suppress text output to screen. Output is still sent to the log file as usual
parameters.name: quiet

parameters.info: Save background mean image as fits file
parameters.name: savefits_meanim

parameters.info: Save norm image as fits file
parameters.name: savefits_normim

parameters.info: Save island rank image as fits file
parameters.name: savefits_rankim

parameters.info: Save residual image as fits file
parameters.name: savefits_residim

parameters.info: Save background rms image as fits file
parameters.name: savefits_rmsim

parameters.info: Name of the run, to be prepended to the name of the output directory. E.g., solname='Run_1'
parameters.name: solnname

parameters.info: Print out extra information during fitting
parameters.name: verbose_fitting

parameters.info: Find polarisation properties
parameters.name: polarisation_do

parameters.info: Check the polarized intesity (PI) image for sources not found in Stokes I
parameters.name: pi_fit

parameters.info: Threshold for PI island boundary in number of sigma above the mean. Uses thresh_isl if not set.
parameters.name: pi_thresh_isl

parameters.info: Source detection threshold for PI image: threshold for the island peak in number of sigma above the mean. Uses thresh_pix if not set.
parameters.name: pi_thresh_pix

parameters.info: Calculate PSF variation across image
parameters.name: psf_vary_do

parameters.info: FWHM of the PSF. Specify as (maj, min, pos ang E of N) in degrees. E.g., psf_fwhm = (0.06, 0.02, 13.3). Estimates from the image if not set
parameters.name: psf_fwhm

parameters.info: SNR above which all sources are taken to be unresolved. E.g., psf_high_snr = 20.0. If unset, no such selection is made
parameters.name: psf_high_snr

parameters.info: 0 = normal, 1 = 0 + round, 2 = LogSNR, 3 =SqrtLogSNR
parameters.name: psf_itess_method

parameters.info: Kappa for clipping for analytic fit
parameters.name: psf_kappa2

parameters.info: Kappa for clipping within each bin
parameters.name: psf_nsig

parameters.info: Factor of nyquist sample for binning bmaj, etc. vs SNR
parameters.name: psf_over

parameters.info: Size of Gaussian to use for smoothing of interpolated images in arcsec. If not set, no smoothing.
parameters.name: psf_smooth

parameters.info: Minimum SNR for statistics
parameters.name: psf_snrcut

parameters.info: Unresolved sources with higher SNR taken for stacked psfs
parameters.name: psf_snrcutstack

parameters.info: Fraction of SNR > snrcut as primary generators
parameters.name: psf_snrtop

parameters.info: Restrict sources to be only of type 'S'
parameters.name: psf_stype_only

parameters.info: Background rms map: True => use 2-D rms map; False => use constant rms; None => calculate inside program
parameters.name: rms_map

parameters.info: Decompose islands into shapelets
parameters.name: shapelet_do

parameters.info: Basis set for shapelet decomposition: 'cartesian' or 'polar'. Fair warning - polar mode was not implemented at the time of writing this info, use at your own risk.
parameters.name: shapelet_basis

parameters.info: Calculate shapelet coeff's by fitting ('fit') or integrating (None). WARNING: the default is 'fit', not none, so to run in default mode, explicitely set this to 'fit', else leave as is.
parameters.name: shapelet_fitmode

parameters.info: Use Gaussian residual image for shapelet decomposition?
parameters.name: shapelet_gresid

parameters.info: Type of thresholding: None => calculate inside program, 'fdr' => use false detection rate algorithm, 'hard' => use sigma clipping
parameters.name: thresh

parameters.info: Threshold for the island boundary in number of sigma above the mean. Determines extent of island used for fitting
parameters.name: thresh_isl

parameters.info: Source detection threshold: threshold for the island peak in number of sigma above the mean. If false detection rate thresholding is used, this value is ignored and thresh_pix is calculated inside the program
parameters.name: thresh_pix

parameters.info: Radius of aperture in pixels inside which aperture fluxes are measured for each source. None => no aperture fluxes measured
parameters.name: aperture

parameters.info: Position the aperture (if aperture is not None) on: 'centroid' or 'peak' of the source.
parameters.name: aperture_posn

parameters.info: Limit in Jy/beam below which pixels are blanked. None => no such blanking is done
parameters.name: blank_limit

parameters.info: Theoretical estimate of number of beams per source. None => calculate inside program
parameters.name: bmpersrc_th

parameters.info: Check for pixels outside the universe
parameters.name: check_outsideuniv

parameters.info: Detection image file name used only for detecting islands of emission. Source measurement is still done on the main image
parameters.name: detection_image

parameters.info: Cache internally derived images to disk
parameters.name: do_cache

parameters.info: stimate uncertainties for 'M'-type sources using Monte Carlo method
parameters.name: do_mc_errors

parameters.info: Alpha for FDR algorithm for thresholds
parameters.name: fdr_alpha

parameters.info: For thresh = None; if #false_pix / #source_pix < fdr_ratio, thresh = 'hard' else thresh = 'fdr'
parameters.name: fdr_ratio

parameters.info: Sigma for clipping Gaussians while creating fitted image
parameters.name: fittedimage_clip

parameters.info: Fix major and minor axes and PA of Gaussians to beam?
parameters.name: fix_to_beam

parameters.info: Group all Gaussians in each island into a single source
parameters.name: group_by_isl

parameters.info: Group Gaussians into sources using 'intensity' map or 'curvature' map
parameters.name: group_method

parameters.info: Tolerance for grouping of Gaussians into sources: larger values will result in larger sources
parameters.name: group_tol

parameters.info: Initial guess for Gaussian parameters: 'default', 'simple', or 'nobeam'
parameters.name: ini_gausfit

parameters.info: Method by which inital guess for fitting of Gaussians is chosen: 'intensity' or 'curvature'
parameters.name: ini_method

parameters.info: Kappa for clipped mean and rms. None => calculate inside program
parameters.name: kappa_clip

parameters.info: Minimum number of pixels with emission per island (minimum is 6 pixels). None -> calculate inside program
parameters.name: minpix_isl

parameters.info: Number of cores to use during fitting, None => use all
parameters.name: ncores

parameters.info: Find and fit peaks of large islands iteratively
parameters.name: peak_fit

parameters.info: If island size in beam area is more than this, attempt to fit peaks iteratively (if peak_fit = True). Min value is 30
parameters.name: peak_maxsize

parameters.info: Value of constant rms in Jy/beam to use if rms_map = False. None => calculate inside program
parameters.name: rms_value

parameters.info: Rank of the interpolating function for rms/mean map
parameters.name: spline_rank

parameters.info: Split island if it is too large, has a large convex deficiency and it opens well.
parameters.name: split_isl

parameters.info: If island size in beam area is more than this, consider splitting island. Min value is 50
parameters.name: splitisl_maxsize

parameters.info: List of source positions at which fitting is done.  E.g., src_ra_dec = [(197.1932, 47.9188), (196.5573, 42.4852)]
parameters.name: src_ra_dec

parameters.info: Radius of the island (if src_ra_dec is not None) in pixels. None => radius is set to the FWHM of the beam major axis.
parameters.name: src_radius_pix

parameters.info: Stops after: 'isl' = island finding step or 'read' = image reading step
parameters.name: stop_at

parameters.info: Do source detection on only a part of the image. Specify as (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) in pixels. E.g., trim_box = (120, 840, 15, 895). None => use entire image
parameters.name: trim_box

parameters.info: Output file name. None => file is named automatically; 'SAMP' => send to SAMP hub (e.g., to TOPCAT, ds9, or Aladin)
parameters.name: outfile

parameters.info: BBS format, type of patch to use: None => no patches. 'single' => all Gaussians in one patch. 'gaussian' => each Gaussian gets its own patch. 'source' => all Gaussians belonging to a single source are grouped into one patch. 'mask' => use mask file specified by bbs_patches_mask
parameters.name: bbs_patches

parameters.info: Name of the mask file (of same size as input image) that defines the patches if bbs_patches = 'mask'
parameters.name: bbs_patches_mask

parameters.info: Type of catalog to write:  'gaul' - Gaussian list, 'srl' - source list (formed by grouping Gaussians), 'shap' - shapelet list (FITS format only)
parameters.name: catalog_type

parameters.info: Overwrite existing file?
parameters.name: clobber

parameters.info: Correct source parameters for image projection (BBS format only)?
parameters.name: correct_proj

parameters.info: Format of output catalog
parameters.name: format

parameters.info: Include flux densities from each channel (if any)?
parameters.name: incl_chan

parameters.info: Include islands without any valid Gaussians (source list only)?
parameters.name: incl_empty

parameters.info: Name for entries in the output catalog (BBS format only). None => use image file name
parameters.name: srcroot

parameters.info: Convert output model to tigger format
parameters.name: port2tigger

parameters.info: Calculate spectral indices (for multi-channel image)
parameters.name: spectralindex_do

parameters.info: Flag channels before (averaging and) extracting spectral index, if their rms is more than 5 (clipped) sigma outside the median rms over all channels, but only if <= 10% of channels
parameters.name: flagchan_rms

parameters.info: Flag channels that do not meet SNR criterion set by specind_snr
parameters.name: flagchan_snr

parameters.info: Maximum number of channels to average for a given source when when attempting to meet target SNR. 1 => no averaging; 0 => no maximum
parameters.name: specind_maxchan

parameters.info: Target SNR to use when fitting power law. If there is insufficient SNR, neighboring channels are averaged to attempt to obtain the target SNR. Channels with SNRs below this will be flagged if flagchan_snr = True
parameters.name: specind_snr

parameters.info: Start frequency (unit => Hz)
parameters.name: freq0
